reviews.review_msg: too hard

The course was not as difficult as other ratings have made it out to be, though it is dense for a 100 lvl/crim class. The final was all mc and we were given multiple times throughout the semester to gain bonus credit. If you apply yourself you'll do well with Chelsey, majority of her questions came right off the slides.
she is fine!! all these ratings are from first years who don't understand crim class format yet. she is boring and just reads off slides but midterm was fair and content is straight forward.

take this class with a prof that actually cares. She reads off the slides and made the final all MC because the TA's hours were cut and she will not cater to a small proportion of people. Test heavy, boring lectures that are long. Also takes ages to respond to emails because of "cooling off" periods. Not worth sitting 2 hours for.
Horribly harsh grader, TA's are useless. if you don't have to take the class, don't.

If you are caring about your GPA, avoid this prof. The grading is really tough and u only have three chances (midterm, paper, final) to maintain your grade. The lecture is very heavy but just she reads off the slides.

Term paper was guided but not given enough help or guidance for theories due to the strike and graded them as if we were doing our honours thesis. Has not been assisting in any way and needed a 48-hour "cool off" period after releasing grades to which ta's and prof is not reponsding to emails. Highly recommend taking with different instructor.

Lectures are directly read from slides with no further in-depth explanations, your grade is determined from 3 main components, midterm, term paper and final exam. Overall classe averages are much lower than they should be for a first year crim course.

she is by far the most boring prof I have had. She reads off the slides that are copied and pasted from the textbook, and she isn't even sure if she wrote it right, she checks the textbook before making each point. she does not engage in lecture and you start to doze off. people leave mid-lecture, and I don't blame them.

Heavy power point slides for lecture teaching.  Reads directly off the slides with little to no explaination on information.  Straight forward testing however does not give part marks, have to memorize the lecture slides word for word because she expects reiteration word for word on exams.  I don't reccomend unless you devote time to the course.

The fact that the class average was 49% but she had to drop questions to make the average 55% is alarming. Very boring lectures that are long. She just reads off the slides that are packed with information, basically forces you to teach yourself. The midterm wasn't tough as long as you know the information but was hard to write all of it
Don't take her class, trust me
bruh.

I wouldn't take this class if she is the prof. She reads word for word her lecture slides and a very monotoned pace. Her midterm was super bad. The class average was 55% which is pretty bad for an un-curved class and a first year class. I recommend that the university takes a second look at hiring her as she is not a good prof.

She wasn't bad, but she wasn't good. She reads everything from the slides and the only reason for u to attend lectures is because some of the slides are fill-in-the-blanks. The midterm was bad, it was heavy on writing and the class had an average of 55%. She seems nice but I don't really like the way she teaches. One of her TAs, Ivana, is the best!

Way too many slides in every lect (~60), not in point form, and she reads off the slides. Not engaging when lecturing, boring. Expects us to know everything. Her midterm was like 70% written and 30% MC which I thought was tough considering there was 1h50min to write it. I find it hard for a 100-level course, personally don't recommend.

HORRIBLE! Do not take this class with this professor. Very boring lectures that will put you to sleep. She gave us a midterm that was very written heavy and covered so many things after not being in lecture for three weeks due to the strike. THE WORST PROF!

GOAT professor. Super knowledgeable about psychopathy and psychological explanations to crime. Assignments/paper's are manageable, as long as you follow guidelines and go to tutorials. Also, ATTEND LECTURES... trust me attending lectures will ensure that you pass exams. 10/10 would take another class with Dr. Evan.

Evan's lecture slides are organized really well and highlight what will be tested material often. If you take solid notes and study his quiz review slides the quizzes are really easy and no textbook material was tested.
Complaint would be that he repeats himself a bit.

Morden is the most condescending prof I've ever had, both to her students and to other grad students.  She makes statements that are blatantly false, but refuses to be corrected (in private and politely). She does try to make the lectures entertaining but this often leads to irrelevant tangents that prevent her from presenting the actual material.

where do I even begin with her. has expectations that are clearly way too high for first year uni course. she thinks its all the students fault that the class average on the midterm was 40 percent and it has nothing to do with her (imagine that) im a 3rd year student for god sakes this instructor is the worst ive had by far. run while you still can

This prof has 0 pro's, literally AVOID UNLESS U ABSOLUTELY CANNOT. her lectures are long, midterm and final were like bad. really bad. the TA'S are not helpful, they grade so hard. as a 3rd year, I have never gotten anything under a B-, let alone a F... so humbling. discussion responses are ok, research paper is graded so tough...

As a first year student, this is the worst class I have taken. the Ta's grade so hard... this is literally a 100 level class and isn't supposed to be as hard as it was made. the weekly modules were crazy lengthy for no reason. A lot of repetition. THE MIDTERM IS THE HARDEST TEST I HAVE EVER TAKEN. The grading is unnecessarily hard which is so crazy

RUN, the average on the midterm (after scaling) was 50%. As a second year who has a 3.4 GPA and is majoring in both psychology and criminology (have taken at least 4 classes in each)...Tell me why I failed the midterm after studying a fair amount, and why that was the hardest test I had ever taken???
Avoid at all costs, I don't know how shes still at SFU.
Awful experience. This should not be a first-year course. Avoid if possible.

Professor Wong is one of the worst professors at SFU she has no clear outlines of what she expects students to do, it's almost as if she just abandons the students. Her lectures are garbage she just reads everything off the slides with minimal explanation. On top of that the TAs are so bad they provide no help. SFU needs to hire a new 103 teacher.

Online version- The written lectures and readings were super interesting each week, sometimes we were assigned documentaries to watch, and if you put a standard amount of effort into the course/do what is required you will be 100% fine for the exams and paper. If the psychology of crime interests you, the course is easy and fascinating tbh!

I don't think anyone should take her class ever. She doesn't really care about the students, and she doesn't really know what she's saying most of the times. She didn't know when was the final scheduled for her class. Her exams are extremely difficult. It's hard to pass the course with her as a prof.
Absolute nightmare, A girl cried in the final... And worst TA ever
